text: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
author: St. Jerome

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: You are what you do, not what you say you'll do.
author: Carl Jung

text: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
author: Dudley Field Malone

text: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
author: Albert Einstein

text: No man is happy unless he believes he is.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: To be in harmony with the wholeness of things is not to have anxiety over imperfections.
author: Dogen

text: Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.
author: Gary Keller

text: Nothing is more creative...nor destructive...than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
author: Dan Brown

text: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best way to understanding is a few good examples.
author: Isaac Newton

text: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
author: Sun Tzu

text: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Time goes from present to past.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: Failure is feedback. Learn from it and move on.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Others can stop you temporarily ? you are the only one who can do it permanently.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: It is those who concentrate on but one thing at a time who advance in this world.
author: Gary Keller

text: Truth is the offspring of silence and meditation.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Routine life is unbearable, and most people only think about how to escape into the world of fantasy and dreams.
author: Robert Greene

text: It's wise to tell the truth. It's even wiser to tell it kindly.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The sweetest pleasure arises from difficulties overcome.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: We have more possibilities available in each moment than we realize.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.
author: Criss Jami

text: The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Fallacies do not cease to be fallacies because they become fashions.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
author: Criss Jami

text: Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: We become what we believe.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.
author: Celestine Chua

text: My instinct is always to seek out challenges as opposed to avoiding them.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

text: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
author: Herodotus

text: Remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: The wise speak only of what they know.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
author: James Allen

text: Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.
author: Rumi

text: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Most of us live our lives by accident ? we live as it happens. Fulfilment comes when we live our lives on purpose.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Stop comparing yourself to others and focus on your own improvement.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.
author: Sun Tzu

text: We have a duty to maintain the light of consciousness to make sure it continues into the future.
author: Elon Musk

text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

text: Don't waste your energy on being angry at something that somebody did six months ago or a year ago. It's over.
author: Joan Rivers

text: Every failure brings with it the seed of an equivalent success.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The world would go on even without you. Don't take yourself so seriously.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: None of us can change our yesterdays but all of us can change our tomorrows.
author: Colin Powell

text: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: The purpose of life is the life of purpose.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The constant assertion of belief is an indication of fear.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
author: John Wooden

text: Whatever we plant in our subconscious mind and nourish with repetition and emotion will one day become reality.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Love is not about possession. Love is about appreciation.
author: Osho

text: The best teacher is experience and not through someone's distorted point of view.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Today I begin a new life. I will greet this day with love in my heart.
author: Og Mandino

text: I don't ever give up. I'd have to be dead or completely incapacitated.
author: Elon Musk

text: Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.
author: James Allen

text: The more acquaintances you have, the less you know them.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're misinformed.
author: Mark Twain

text: A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: I am thankful to all those who said no. It's because of them, I did it myself.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The opportunity of defeating the enemy is provided by the enemy himself.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Mark Twain

text: Give so much away people insist on paying you.
author: Jack Butcher

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: You're never given a dream without also being given the power to make it true.
author: Richard Bach

text: When a man is penalized for honesty he learns to lie.
author: Criss Jami

text: The world doesn't always give you want, but it often gives you what you need.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: You can tell more about a person by what he says about others than you can by what others say about him.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Know yourself and you will win all battles.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Take into account that great love and great achievements involve great risk.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well.
author: Jack London

text: You can only be afraid of what you think you know.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Friendship is one of the most tangible things in a world which offers fewer and fewer supports.
author: Kenneth Branagh

text: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
author: Zhuangzi

text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.
author: Robin Sharma

text: There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.
author: Huang Po

text: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.
author: Barack Obama

text: Mistake is a mistake only if you make it twice.
author: Robin Sharma

text: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Anyone who wants to achieve a dream must stay strong, focused and steady.
author: Estee Lauder

text: I think it's very important to have a feedback loop, where you're constantly thinking about what you've done and how you could be doing it better.
author: Elon Musk

text: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

text: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.
author: Celestine Chua

text: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them.
author: Henry Ford

text: To accomplish big things, I am convinced you must first dream big dreams.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: You do not read a book for the book's sake, but for your own.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.
author: Mark Twain

text: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Confucius

text: Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Little by little, one travels far.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: People should pursue what they're passionate about. That will make them happier than pretty much anything else.
author: Elon Musk

text: Wheels of justice grind slow but grind fine.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.
author: Euripides

text: Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence.
author: Osho

text: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
author: Epictetus

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: If you can't, you must. If you must, you can.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Do Something. If it works, do more of it. If it doesn't, do something else.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Note that this journey is uniquely yours, no one elses. So the path has to be your own.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Trust, but verify.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
author: Genghis Khan

text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
author: Henry Ford

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: I defeat my enemies when I make them my friends.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Either you choose to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out into the ocean.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: It is not that we have too little time to do all the things we need to do , it is that we feel the need to do too many things in the time we have.
author: Gary Keller

text: Worry is a waste of emotional reserve.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Changing minds is harder than finding people who already agree.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: In life you need either inspiration or desperation.
author: Tony Robbins

text: If you always do what you've always done, you'll always get what you've always got.
author: Henry Ford

text: Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.
author: Colin Powell

text: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: She who loves roses must be patient and not cry out when she is pierced by thorns.
author: Kenji Miyazawa

text: Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there's nothing more to live for.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
author: Lao Tzu

text: You play the hand you're dealt. I think the game's worthwhile.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Don't want anything. Then you get everything.
author: Seungsahn

text: The difference between treason and patriotism is only a matter of dates.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: Being spiritual has nothing to do with what you believe and everything to do with your state of consciousness.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
author: Alexander Pope

text: The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability.
author: Henry Ford

text: Keep others in suspense, cultivate an air of unpredictability.
author: Robert Greene

text: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Simple words, repeated daily, can change your life.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: There's no coming to consciousness without pain
author: Carl Jung

text: Each path to knowledge involves different rules and these rules are not interchangeable.
author: Barack Obama

text: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground upon which I stand.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: If you don't like something change it; if you can't change it, change the way you think about it.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: Live your life as an exclamation rather than an explanation.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.
author: Stephen King

text: Life is a challenge, meet it! Life is a dream, realize it! Life is a game, play it! Life is love, enjoy it!
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Success is about creating value.
author: Candice Carpenter

text: Adversity is the tempering of one's mettle. Without it, we cannot know any true meaning in our accomplishments.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: There is no excuse for not trying.
author: Barack Obama

text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: We shape clay into a pot, but it is the emptiness inside that holds whatever we want.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Consider the rights of others before your own feelings, and the feelings of others before your own rights.
author: John Wooden

text: Focused, hard work is the real key to success.
author: John Carmack

text: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.
author: George Washington

text: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking.
author: Joan Rivers

text: It is useless to meet revenge with revenge; it will heal nothing.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.
author: William James

text: To earn more you must learn more.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
author: Coco Chanel

text: I discovered a long time ago that if I helped enough people get what they wanted, I would always get what I wanted and I would never have to worry.
author: Tony Robbins

text: When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.
author: Robert Greene

text: If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
author: James Allen

text: You know the more one does the more one can do.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: I have no methods; all I do is accept people as they are.
author: Joan Rivers

text: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
author: Henry Ford

text: Remember, hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things.
author: Stephen King

text: Try all things, hold fast that which is good.
author: John Locke

text: Debt is the slavery of the free.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Give out what you most want to come back.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Margaret Mead

text: An un-examined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: If light is in your heart, you will find your way home.
author: Rumi

text: You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

text: Life should be touched, not strangled.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Love yourself with the same intensity you would use to pull yourself up if you were hanging off a cliff.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: If you want peace, accept. If you want suffering, expect.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Everything eaten is killed. Every meal is a sacrifice.
author: Adi Da Samraj

text: In youth we run into difficulties. In old age difficulties run into us.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Over time, loneliness gets inside you and doesn't go away.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.
author: George Eliot

text: My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Success is built sequentially. It's one thing at a time.
author: Gary Keller

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

text: If you want to be sad, no one in the world can make you happy. But if you make up your mind to be happy, no one and nothing on earth can take that happiness from you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: There is an essence of when you are fearless, you become more creative.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Lack of emotion causes lack of progress and lack of motivation.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Everything has beauty but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: Conflict cannot survive without your participation.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Loss is nothing else but change and change is nature's delight.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Words are the clothes thoughts wear.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Too much sanity may be madness and the maddest of all, to see life as it is and not as it should be.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Do not bite at the bait of pleasure, till you know there is no hook beneath it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Thoughts become things. If you see it in your mind, you will hold it in your hand.
author: Bob Proctor

text: When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Be content with what you have, rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A very little key will open a very heavy door.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Passion is born deaf and dumb.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
author: Audrey Hepburn
